pros: 4-Day Work Week, Great Insurance, Co-workers are great
cons: Not much room for advancement as most departments have long term people in a majority of positions

review_title: Good Place to Work, but Unwilling to Improve
pros:
- 4 Day work week
- Great insurance 
- Discounted tuition (should you want to pursue education)
cons:
- Pay
- Raises don't exist (cost of living or incentive for your long-time loyalty)
- Poor communication, especially considering how small of an institution UM is
- The listening skill is lacking in many leadership areas

review_title: Associate Professor at University of Mobile
pros:
• Caring students
• Beautiful, safe campus
• Flexibility
• Less pressure to conduct "research"
cons:
• Low pay
• Extra duties assigned without compensation

pros: Family-like environment, Great insurance benefits, great education benefits, uplifting atmosphere
cons: Low pay, limited opportunity for advancement

review_title: Great place with great people, but pay could be better.
pros: Great supervisors, office staff, and coworkers. Positive, focused, and fast-paced environment. No micromanaging. Able to complete homework during work hours if all other work is completed.
cons: Pay is minimum wage ($7.25/hr). There are opportunities for position advancements and/or shifts, but pay for student workers does not change.

pros: I could walk to all of my classes. They were very supportive of my faith and would build me up.
cons: I had to travel from home because the tuition was so high.

pros: The staff is incredible, professors are awesome, and mid level management is incredible.
cons: Some students are troublesome and can be frustrating, but it is good for one to adjust to.

review_title: Awesome place to start your career
job_title: Food Service Worker in Mobile, AL
pros: Good coworkers and easy to advance

great atmosphere
teachers who care
lots of foreign students
lots of sport involvement
cons: I liked everything, no cons for me

pros: Great job for connecting and working while studying.
